glsa.title: SUS: Local root vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: SUS contains a string format bug that could lead to local privilege escalation.

background.p: SUS is a utility that allows regular users to be able to execute certain commands as root.

description.p: Leon Juranic found a bug in the logging functionality of SUS that can lead to local privilege escalation. A format string vulnerability exists in the log() function due to an incorrect call to the syslog() function.

impact.p: An attacker with local user privileges can potentially exploit this vulnerability to gain root access.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All SUS users should upgrade to the latest version:
